items.title: Viral apple cider vinegar weight loss study retracted for flawed science
bullets: • BMJ Group has retracted research suggesting that small daily quantities of apple cider vinegar might help people who are overweight or obese to lose weight
• The small clinical trial was published in the open access journal BMJ Nutrition, Prevention & Health in March 2024 and its findings press released

items.title: The billion-year reign of fungi that predated plants and made Earth livable
bullets: • Fungi may have shaped Earth’s landscapes long before plants appeared
• They may have partnered with algae, recycling nutrients, breaking down rock, and creating primitive ecosystems
• The discovery could help explain the origin of life in the world's most complex ecosystems

items.title: This ultra-thin solar tech could power everything from phones to skyscrapers
bullets: • Researchers at Chalmers University of Technology in Sweden unraveled the structure of a promising solar material using machine learning and advanced simulations
• Their findings could unlock durable, ultra-efficient solar cells for a rapidly electrifying world
• Solar cells could be so thin and flexible that they could encase anything from mobile phones to skyscrapers

items.title: Before they sucked blood, leeches were ocean hunters
bullets: • A 430-million-year-old fossil reveals leeches began as ocean hunters long before they evolved into bloodsuckers
• Unlike today’s bloodsucking leeches, their ancient ancestors likely hunted small marine animals using a tail sucker rather than piercing skin

items.title: At least two people have been killed in an attack at a U.K. synagogue
bullets: • Prime Minister Keir Starmer calls the attack "appalling" and "all the more horrific" Police say the suspected attacker was shot but his condition remains unconfirmed
• King Charles III says he and Queen Camilla are "deeply saddened and shocked" by the attack

items.title: VIDEO: Trump's tariffs, changing markets and what an uncertain economy means for you
bullets: • President Trump promised to fuel an economic boom with a magic bullet: tariffs
• They're taxes added to a wide range of imports and money is coming in, more than $30 billion a month
• It's unclear what the larger impact of these tariffs will have on the economy
• Despite that, the president keeps promising to roll out new ones

items.title: Pressure on Democrats grows to end shutdown. And, Gaza City receives evacuation orders
bullets: • White House budget director, Russ Vought, announces $8 billion for energy projects in 16 states, all of which are considered blue states
• Vice President JD Vance has warned that federal workforce layoffs will happen if the shutdown continues
• Government services, like Social Security payments and Medicaid, are expected to be unaffected by the shutdown

items.title: 5 takeaways from NPR's investigation into the role of distribution lines in LA fires
bullets: • NPR's investigation into the role of distribution lines in the Eaton fire in Los Angeles
• The Eaton fire destroyed more than 9,000 buildings and led to 19 deaths in January
• NPR found that high power transmission lines were not the only kind of electrical equipment that caused problems

items.title: In Trump country, a Democrat critiques Trump — and talks of succeeding him
bullets: • Andy Beshear has twice won election as governor of Kentucky
• He is considering a run for president
• He spoke in an all-platform interview with NPR's Up First podcast and Morning Edition
• He says Trump owns any damage from the government shutdown

items.title: Saturn’s icy moon Enceladus just revealed stunning new clues to life
bullets: • Analysis of Cassini data has revealed new complex organic molecules inside ice grains spewing from Enceladus
• This is a clear sign that complex chemical reactions are taking place within the moon's underground ocean
• Scientists now believe the moon could be habitable, and plans are underway for a European mission to sample its surface and jets

items.title: Tesla finally had a good sales quarter — it may be the last one for a while
bullets: • Tesla delivered 497,099 vehicles, including 481,166 Model 3 and Model Y vehicles
• The company was expected to have a good quarter thanks to expiring $7,500 tax credits
• That figure is a 5 percent drop from the third quarter of 2014

items.title: Super Mario Galaxy deserves more
bullets: • Nintendo has brought two of the very best Super Mario games to the Switch and Switch 2
• The Galaxy games originally debuted in 2007 and 2010, represent a sort of evolutionary offshoot of the 3D Mario platforming line
• The goal, as always, is to collect shiny stars to open up more levels to explore
• But what makes Galaxy and its sequel unique is how tightly-focused every level is

items.title: Hulu isn’t going away after all — it’s going global
bullets: • Hulu will replace Star on Disney Plus in international markets starting on October 8th
• Hulu will become the company’s “global general entertainment brand” in preparation for the ‘unified” Disney Plus app experience
• This announcement follows speculation that Hulu would disappear in 2026

items.title: T-Mobile’s satellite service now supports Google Maps, WhatsApp, X, and more
bullets: • T-Mobile’s satellite-to-cell service now supports WhatsApp, Google Maps, X, AccuWeather, and more
• The Starlink-powered “T-Satellite” service lets users stay connected without cellular coverage
• The service already provides connectivity to native apps on select iPhone, Pixel, and Samsung phones

items.title: HP’s new 49-inch curved ultrawide monitor has a pop-up webcam
bullets: • HP is announcing a new jumbo-sized ultrawide monitor designed for productivity and office use
• The HP Series 5 Pro 49-inch Conferencing Monitor uses a 32:9 VA IPS panel with 5120 x 1440 resolution, 165Hz refresh, and an 1800R curvature
• It sports a hidden webcam with Windows Hello support that extends from its top when you push to unlock it
